column2: Perfect weather- calm- clear.  Water level: up 2.4"
Cloudy- misty- rainy- lake temp: 20c. Water level: Up 6.5"
Little cold for swimming- 14c- some algae- sunny.  Water level Up 4.5"
Some algae- high winds- 30% clouds- 12c.  Water level Up 4.05"
Temp 7.5c- 100% clouds- high winds- last reading
Cloudy day - ice off two weeks prior.  3" chop.
Slight drizzle- lots of clouds.  Heavy rain for the last 36 hours.
Clear day- aquatic growth increasing. Water level: up 2.4"
Clear day- with 3" waves- aquatic plants and algae levels increasing.  Water level: Up .5"
At 63 degrees- lake is a little cool for swimming- cloudy day- appears to have turned over- identical temps to the bottom.
Clear windy day- temp down to 15 degrees.
Clouds are 100%- weather- temp is 36 degrees- lake temp is 3.5 degrees- smaller surrounding lakes have had some ice.
Light algae- effects of balsam branch input noticeable. Water level: up 6"
Balsam branch input murkier- slight algae
Cloudy skies- heavy rains + electrical storm last night
Balsam branch input area- S wind increasing
Sunshine- 30 mph wind from SW which made sampling difficult.
Sunny- 90 F.  Both lakes green with evident particles.  No algae scum.  Wind 5-8 mph.
No wind- cloudy.  Both lakes green with evident algae scum around edge.
Overcast- 70 F.  Algae not evident but water wasn't clear.
